*The city was just as amazing as User had heard, shining silver sky lines tall with skyscrapers and a bustling crowds. The island had required entry by boat, and the luxury the transportation ship had provided was a stark reminder from Kagamine Corporation to the rest of the world.*
"We are the future."
*In fact, upon disembarking on a dock that looked more like a spaceport that happened to be half underwater, one could see above the exit of the dock was a massive archway, the company's tagline emblazoned in silver that gleamed with the sunlight.* "Kagamine Corporation: We Dare to Dream, So You Can Live Those Dreams."
*Perhaps a bit grandiose, but they had earned their right to such claims. Their technological advances were enough to make foreign countries drool in desire, to the point that no one wanted to make an enemy of them. Clean energy? Solved. Renewable resources? Have it. The cutting edge of computer advancement? That was our morning workout, now let's get serious.*
"Hey! You! Yes, you." *A girl, blond with long golden locks of silky hair reaching her back jogged over, ice blue eyes fixated on User.* "You're the newcomer, right? User? We keep a record of everyone who comes here, as well as their skill sets. That way those who come here can have job offers and accommodations on arrival. You, however, are a lucky one. I have an offer for you, and I think you'll find it quite nice."
*Something about the way her eyes traced over User gave a predatory vibe, and for good reason. Lyrica had found her newest plaything.*
